meanings.definition: 楽しむ、面白がる、愉快に過ごす
meanings.english_definition: to have fun; to enjoy oneself; to have a good time

examples.sentence: Eu quero me divertir na festa.
examples.translation: I want to have fun at the party.
examples.english_translation: I want to have fun at the party.

examples.sentence: Nós nos divertimos muito durante as férias.
examples.translation: We had a lot of fun during the vacation.
examples.english_translation: We had a lot of fun during the vacation.

examples.sentence: Espero que você se divirta no show.
examples.translation: I hope you enjoy the show.
examples.english_translation: I hope you enjoy the show.

collocations: divertir-se com (algo) - to have fun with (something)
divertir-se muito - to have a lot of fun
divertir-se à grande - to have a great time

meanings.definition: 気を紛らわす、憂さを晴らす
meanings.english_definition: to distract oneself; to take one's mind off things

examples.sentence: Ele tenta se divertir para esquecer os problemas.
examples.translation: He tries to distract himself to forget his problems.
examples.english_translation: He tries to distract himself to forget his problems.

examples.sentence: Ela se diverte lendo livros para não pensar no trabalho.
examples.translation: She distracts herself by reading books so she doesn't think about work.
examples.english_translation: She distracts herself by reading books so she doesn't think about work.

collocations: divertir-se com alguma coisa para esquecer os problemas - to distract oneself with something to forget the problems

etymology.value: Derives from the verb 'divertir', which comes from Latin 'divertere' (to turn aside, to go in different directions). The reflexive form 'divertir-se' implies turning oneself away from something serious or unpleasant to find enjoyment.

inflection.notes: This is a reflexive verb, so it requires the use of reflexive pronouns (me, te, se, nos, vos, se).

usage_notes.explanation: 'Divertir-se' is a reflexive verb, meaning the action is performed by the subject on themselves. It is used to express the idea of having a good time, enjoying oneself, or finding amusement in something. It can also mean to distract oneself from worries or problems. The reflexive pronoun must agree with the subject.

examples.note: Missing the reflexive pronoun. Reflexive pronouns are required for this verb.
When followed by an infinitive, it's common to use the preposition 'a' in Portuguese.

readability_explanation.text: 'Divertir-se' means 'to have fun' or 'to enjoy yourself.' It is a reflexive verb, so you need to use 'me,' 'te,' 'se,' 'nos,' 'vos,' or 'se' before the verb, depending on who is having fun. For example, 'Eu divirto-me' means 'I have fun,' and 'Eles divertem-se' means 'They have fun.' It's a common verb used to talk about leisure activities and enjoying life.

example_sentences.sentence: As crianças divertiram-se muito no parque.
example_sentences.translation: The children had a lot of fun at the park.

example_sentences.sentence: Espero que te divirtas nas férias!
example_sentences.translation: I hope you have fun on vacation!

example_sentences.sentence: Nós divertimo-nos a jogar jogos de tabuleiro.
example_sentences.translation: We have fun playing board games.
